name: swooning
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
feeling or expressing a lot of pleasure, love, etc.: On Wednesday, she found herself at the Paramount playing in front of 3,000 swooning fans. The bossa nova beat, lilting jazz flute, and swooning cellos conjure a vision of sun and palm trees.
More examplesFewer examplesThe swooning hero and heroine lean in for the fairy-tale kiss and the camera pans to a colourful field of flowers.With its strings and swooning guitars, the track sounds lushly romantic.Sinatra drew screaming crowds and swooning girls before Elvis Presley and the Beatles did.
